name: Pheromosa & Buzzwole-GX
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: During your next turn, this Pokemon's Elegant Sole attack's base damage is 60.

name: Caterpie
flavorText: Perhaps because it would like to grow up quickly, it has a voracious appetite, eating a hundred leaves a day.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokemon and put it onto this Pokemon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Metapod
flavorText: Its shell is filled with a thick liquid. All of the cells throughout its body are being rebuilt in preparation for evolution.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokemon and put it onto this Pokemon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Butterfree
flavorText: Its wings are covered in toxic scales. If it finds bird Pokemon going after Caterpie, Butterfree sprinkles its scales on them to drive them off.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokemon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Oddish
flavorText: During the day, It stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Oddish
flavorText: During the day, It stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.

name: Gloom
flavorText: Smells incredibly foul! However, around one out of a thousand people enjoy sniffing its nose-bending stink.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if your opponent's Bench isn't full, you may flip a coin. If heads, your opponent reveals their hand. Put a Basic Pokemon you find there onto their Bench.

name: Vileplume
flavorText: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, choose Asleep, Burned, Confused, or Poisoned. Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now affected by that Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokemon.

name: Venonat
flavorText: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At night, its kind is drawn by light.
Attack1Text: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

name: Venonat
flavorText: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At night, its kind is drawn by light.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Venomoth
flavorText: The scales it scatters will paralyze anyone who touches them, making that person unable to stand.
Attack1Text: You can use this attack only if your opponent's Active Pokemon is affected by a Special Condition. This attack does 90 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Venomoth-GX
Attack1Text: If you played Koga's Trap from your hand during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage. If you played Janine from your hand during this turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokemon by attacks from Basic Pokemon during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 10 cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Bellsprout
flavorText: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey.

name: Weepinbell
flavorText: The leafy parts act as cutters for slashing foes. It spits a fluid that dissolves everything.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Burned and Poisoned.

name: Victreebel
flavorText: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.
Attack1Text: This attack does 60 more damage for each Special Condition affecting your opponent's Active Pokemon.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon has no Abilities until the end of your next turn.

name: Tangela
flavorText: Many writhing vines cover it, so its true identity remains unknown. The blue vines grow its whole life long.
Attack1Text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon with their Active Pokemon.

name: Tangrowth
flavorText: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: If this Pokemon has at least 2 Grass Energy attached to it, heal 60 damage from this Pokemon.

name: Grubbin
flavorText: If you find its nest, you shouldn't stick your hand inside. You'll get bitten by an irritated Grubbin.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Lightning Pokemon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Kartana
flavorText: This Ultra Beast's body, which is as thin as paper, is like a sharpened sword.
Attack1Text: If you have exactly 4 Prize cards remaining, this attack does 120 more damage.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, put damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokemon until its remaining HP is 10.

name: Reshiram & Charizard-GX
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokemon.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon can't use Flare Strike during your next turn.

name: Growlithe
flavorText: While it's quite friendly toward humans once it's grown used to them, in the wild it must be quite fierce to defend its territory from Rockruff.

name: Arcanine
flavorText: Legends tell of its fighting alongside a general and conquering a whole country.
Attack1Text: Attach 2 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokemon.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon does 50 damage to itself.

name: Darumaka
flavorText: Darumaka's droppings are hot, so people used to put them in their clothes to keep themselves warm.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to this Pokemon. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Darmanitan
flavorText: When one is injured in a fierce battle, it hardens into a stone-like form. Then it meditates and sharpens its mind.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 3 Fire Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Discard all Fire Energy from this Pokemon.

name: Volcanion
flavorText: It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. It's said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokemon. If you go second and it's your first turn, instead search for up to 3 Fire Energy cards and attach them to your Pokemon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: If you have at least 4 Fire Energy in play, this attack does 60 more damage.

name: Litten
flavorText: If you try too hard to get close to it, it won't open up to you. Even if you do grow close, giving it too much affection is still a no-no.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Burned.

name: Litten
flavorText: If you try too hard to get close to it, it won't open up to you. Even if you do grow close, giving it too much affection is still a no-no.
Attack1Text: Draw a card. If you do, this Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Torracat
flavorText: It can act spoiled if it grows close to its Trainer. A powerful Pokemon, its sharp claws can leave its Trainer's whole body covered in scratches.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Burned.

name: Incineroar
flavorText: Although it's rough mannered and egotistical, it finds beating down unworthy opponents boring. It gets motivated for stronger opponents.
Ability1Text: Your Pokemon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokemon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't apply more than 1 Strong Cheer Ability at a time.
Attack1Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokemon.

name: Salandit
flavorText: The males will do whatever the females tell them. They give the females most of their food. Due to malnutrition, the males can't evolve.
Attack1Text: Discard a Grass Energy from your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Salazzle
flavorText: Salazzle lives deep in caves and forces the Salandit it has attracted with its pheromones to serve it.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Fire Energy card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards.

name: Blacephalon
flavorText: It slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the explosion of its own head. It's apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.
Attack1Text: Turn 1 of your face-down Prize cards face up. If it's a Fire Energy card, this attack does 50 more damage. (That Prize card remains face up for the rest of the game.)
Attack2Text: Discard any number of Fire Energy cards from your hand. This attack does 50 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

name: Squirtle
flavorText: It shelters itself in its shell, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Wartortle
flavorText: When tapped, this Pokemon will pull in its head, but its tail will still stick out a little bit.
Ability1Text: This Pokemon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: This Pokemon can't attack during your next turn.

name: Blastoise-GX
Ability1Text: This Pokemon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: Shuffle any amount of Water Energy from your Pokemon into your deck. This attack does 60 damage for each card you shuffled into your deck in this way.
Attack2Text: Attach any number of Water Energy cards from your hand to your Pokemon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Poliwag
flavorText: Despite the danger, it wants to come up on land. So it does its best to waddle along, but when an enemy finds it, it rushes back to the water.
Ability1Text: You can use this Ability only if you go second. Once during your first turn (before your attack), you may leave your opponent's Active Pokemon Confused.

name: Poliwag
flavorText: Despite the danger, it wants to come up on land. So it does its best to waddle along, but when an enemy finds it, it rushes back to the water.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokemon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Poliwhirl
flavorText: Although it has become capable of living on land, it spends its time in the water, where its prey, fish Pokemon, are plentiful.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Poliwrath
flavorText: It's quite a gifted swimmer, even among Water-type Pokemon, but it normally spends its time on land.
Attack2Text: If Poliwag and Poliwhirl are on your Bench, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Tentacool
flavorText: It drifts through the sea searching for prey. Its poisonous tentacles break off sometimes, but after a while, they grow back.
Attack1Text: If you played Janine from your hand during this turn, this attack does 50 more damage.

name: Tentacruel
flavorText: It fires off ultrasonic waves from its red orbs to weaken its prey, and then it wraps them up in its 80 tentacles.
Attack1Text: Move an Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokemon to another of their Pokemon. If you do, put 3 damage counters on the Pokemon you moved the Energy to.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Slowpoke
flavorText: There are some places where Slowpoke is worshiped because of a long-standing belief that whenever Slowpoke yawns, it rains.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokemon's attacks do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Slowbro
flavorText: Spacing out is basically all it does. It turns back into Slowpoke if its tail, along with Shellder, breaks off.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 100 damage for each heads. If all of them are tails, you lose this game.

name: Seel
flavorText: It has always been supposed that Seel live only in cold seas. Their having shown up in Alola is a mystery.

name: Dewgong
flavorText: It swims through the ocean at a speed of eight knots, searching for Pokemon that will become its prey. It's especially fond of Wishiwashi.
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokemon. This attack does 60 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Krabby
flavorText: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.

name: Kingler
flavorText: Its large and hard pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, being so big, it is unwieldy to move.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Goldeen
flavorText: Although known for their splendid tail fins, Goldeen apparently compete among themselves to see whose horn is thickest and sharpest.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokemon during your opponent's next turn.

name: Seaking
flavorText: Its horn spins like a drill to steadily hollow out rocks—even harder ones. The coloration of the male is more vivid.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads. If this Pokemon has a Pokemon Tool card attached to it, flip 6 coins instead.

name: Kyurem
flavorText: This legendary ice Pokemon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Water Energy card and attach it to this Pokemon. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Water Energy from this Pokemon. Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Froakie
flavorText: It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

name: Frogadier
flavorText: It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.
Attack1Text: If any damage is done to this Pokemon by attacks during your opponent's next turn, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

name: Pyukumuku
flavorText: The tradition known as Pyukumuku chucking started from the custom of throwing Pyukumuku back into the sea after they wash onshore.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokemon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: You and your opponent play Rock-Paper-Scissors. If you win, this attack does 60 more damage.

name: Pikachu
flavorText: Its nature is to store up electricity. Forests where nests of Pikachu live are dangerous, since the trees are so often struck by lightning.

name: Raichu
flavorText: As electricity builds up inside its body, it becomes more aggressive. One theory is that the electricity buildup is actually causing stress.
Attack1Text: You can use this attack only if you have at least 3 more Prize cards remaining than your opponent. Attach all Lightning Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokemon in any way you like.

name: Stunfisk
flavorText: Its skin is very hard, so it is unhurt even if stepped on by sumo wrestlers. It smiles when transmitting electricity.
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: This attack does 30 damage for each of your Pokemon that has any damage counters on it.

name: Dedenne-GX
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokemon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard your hand and draw 6 cards. You can't use more than 1 Dedechange Ability each turn.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed. Put this Pokemon and all cards attached to it into your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Charjabug
flavorText: It buries itself in fallen leaves and barely moves, munching away on humus. If you accidentally step on one, you'll get a shock!
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Vikavolt or Vikavolt-GX as a Special Energy card. This card provides 2 Lightning Energy only while it's attached to a Pokemon.

name: Vikavolt
flavorText: It has an organ that generates electricity in its abdomen. It concentrates energy in its strong jaws and fires off powerful jolts of electricity.
Ability1Text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this Pokemon has no Weakness.
Attack1Text: You may discard all Lightning Energy from this Pokemon. If you do, this attack does 100 more damage.

name: Zeraora
flavorText: It electrifies its claws and tears its opponents apart with them. Even if they dodge its attack, they'll be electrocuted by the flying sparks.
Attack1Text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Discard all Lightning Energy from this Pokemon. This attack does 50 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

name: Muk & Alolan Muk-GX
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Poisoned. Put 8 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokemon between turns.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is Poisoned, heal 100 damage from this Pokemon.

name: Ekans
flavorText: By dislocating its jaw, it can swallow prey larger than itself. After a meal, it curls up and rests.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Arbok
flavorText: The latest research has determined that there are over 20 possible arrangements of the patterns on its stomach.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: If this Pokemon used Wrap during your last turn, this attack does 120 more damage.

name: Zubat
flavorText: It has no eyeballs, so it can't see. It checks its surroundings via the ultrasonic waves it emits from its mouth.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is Poisoned, this attack does 50 more damage.

name: Golbat
flavorText: Every once in a while, you'll see a Golbat that's missing some fangs. This happens when hunger drives it to try biting a Steel-type Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Heal from this Pokemon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Crobat
flavorText: Its fangs are so sharp, if it bites you in the dark and sucks your blood, you won't notice any pain or realize you've been bitten.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokemon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon during your turn, you may prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, including damage, done to this Pokemon until the end of your opponent's next turn.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Poisoned. Put 4 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokemon between turns.

name: Gastly
flavorText: It's said that gas emanating from a graveyard was possessed by the grievances of the deceased and thus became a Pokemon.
Ability1Text: When this Pokemon is Knocked Out, search your deck for up to 2 Haunter and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Gastly
flavorText: It's said that gas emanating from a graveyard was possessed by the grievances of the deceased and thus became a Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Haunter
flavorText: On moonless nights, Haunter searches for someone to curse, so it's best not to go out walking around.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Poisoned. Put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon.

name: Gengar
flavorText: You can hear tales told all over the world about how Gengar will pay a visit to children who are naughty.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokemon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon during your turn, you may put 6 damage counters on your opponent's Pokemon-GX and Pokemon-EX in any way you like.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

name: Drowzee
flavorText: It can be spotted near recreational facilities, intending to eat the pleasant dreams of children who enjoyed themselves there that day.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Hypno
flavorText: In Alola, Komala is Hypno's main target. It rarely harms people.
Ability1Text: When your opponent's Active Pokemon is Knocked Out, flip a coin. If heads, choose which of your opponent's Benched Pokemon becomes their new Active Pokemon.
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 more damage for each card in your opponent's hand.

name: Koffing
flavorText: Its thin, balloon-like body is inflated by horribly toxic gases. It reeks when it is nearby.
Attack1Text: Both Active Pokemon are now Confused.

name: Weezing
flavorText: If one of the twin Koffing inflates, the other one deflates. It constantly mixes its poisonous gases.
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Basic Pokemon between turns.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Mewtwo
flavorText: It was created by a scientist after years of horrific gene-splicing and DNA-engineering experiments.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokemon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may put a Supporter card from your discard pile on top of your deck.
Attack1Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Mew
flavorText: Because it can use all kinds of moves, many scientists believe Mew to be the ancestor of Pokemon.
Ability1Text: Prevent all damage done to your Benched Pokemon by your opponent's attacks.
Attack1Text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokemon in any way you like.

name: Misdreavus
flavorText: What gives meaning to its life is surprising others. If you set your ear against the red orbs around its neck, you can hear shrieking.
Attack1Text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokemon.

name: Mismagius
flavorText: Feared for its wrath and the curses it spreads, this Pokemon will also, on a whim, cast spells that help people.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand. If you drew any cards in this way, this Pokemon is Knocked Out.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Espurr
flavorText: The organ that emits its intense psychic power is sheltered by its ears to keep power from leaking out.
Attack1Text: Draw a card. If you do, this Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon for each damage counter on that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Meowstic
flavorText: When in danger, it raises its ears and releases enough psychic power to grind a 10-ton truck into dust.
Attack1Text: Draw 3 cards. If you do, this Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon's Weakness is now Psychic until the end of your next turn. (The amount of Weakness doesn't change.)

name: Marshadow
flavorText: It slips into the shadows of others and mimics their powers and movements. As it improves, it becomes stronger than those it's imitating.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokemon is on your Bench, you may discard any Stadium card in play. If you do, discard this Pokemon and all cards attached to it.
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is an Ultra Beast, this attack does 60 more damage.

name: Marshadow & Machamp-GX
Attack1Text: If any of your Pokemon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Sandshrew
flavorText: It lives in areas of limited rainfall. When danger approaches, it curls up into a ball to protect its soft stomach.
Attack1Text: Draw a card.

name: Sandslash
flavorText: Its claws and horns often break off. The broken claws and horns can be used to carve plows for tilling farm fields.
Attack1Text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Diglett
flavorText: It travels through tunnels that it digs underground. It hates sunlight, so it comes out only after the sun goes down.
Ability1Text: If you discard this Pokemon with the effect of Giovanni's Exile, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

name: Dugtrio
flavorText: While the three of them normally get along splendidly, on rare occasions a huge fight will break out over which head gets to eat first.
Attack1Text: If you have any Stadium card in play, this attack does 60 more damage.

name: Geodude
flavorText: Geodude that have lived a long life have had all their edges smoothed out until they're totally round. They also have a calm, quiet disposition.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokemon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

name: Graveler
flavorText: It climbs up cliffs as it heads toward the peak of a mountain. As soon as it reaches the summit, it rolls back down the way it came.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon does 30 damage to itself.

name: Golem
flavorText: When Golem grow old, they stop shedding their shells. Those that have lived a long, long time have shells green with moss.
Attack1Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.
Attack2Text: This attack does 20 less damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokemon's Retreat Cost.

name: Cubone
flavorText: At night, it weeps loudly for its dead mother, but those cries only attract its natural enemy—Mandibuzz.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, this Pokemon's Beat attack's base damage is 80.

name: Marowak
flavorText: It throws bones at Mandibuzz to knock it down. It's thought that Marowak is trying to avenge its parent.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon has a Pokemon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 70 more damage.

name: Rhyhorn
flavorText: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokemon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging Tackles.
Attack1Text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokemon with 1 of their Benched Pokemon.

name: Rhyhorn
flavorText: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokemon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging Tackles.

name: Rhydon
flavorText: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
Attack1Text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck. If you played Giovanni's Exile from your hand during this turn, discard the top 5 cards instead.

name: Rhyperior
flavorText: From holes in its palms, it fires out Geodude. Its carapace can withstand volcanic eruptions.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon is a Basic Pokemon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Wooper
flavorText: This Pokemon lives in cold water. It will leave the water to search for food when it gets cold outside.

name: Quagsire
flavorText: It has a sluggish nature. It lies at the river's bottom, waiting for prey to stray into its mouth.

name: Gligar
flavorText: It usually clings to cliffs. When it spots its prey, it spreads its wings and glides down to attack.
Ability1Text: If this Pokemon has no Energy attached to it, it has no Retreat Cost.
Attack1Text: If you played Janine from your hand during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Gliscor
flavorText: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!
Attack1Text: Draw 3 cards.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Tyrogue
flavorText: It is always bursting with energy. To make itself stronger, it keeps on fighting even if it loses.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

name: Hitmontop
flavorText: It fights while spinning like a top. The centrifugal force boosts its destructive power by 10.
Attack1Text: You can use this attack only if your Hitmonlee used Special Combo during your last turn. This attack does 60 damage to each of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Riolu
flavorText: It knows how people and Pokemon feel by looking at their auras. It doesn't approach dangerous opponents.
Attack1Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

name: Landorus
flavorText: Lands visited by Landorus grant such bountiful crops that it has been hailed as "The Guardian of the Fields."
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: Move an Energy from this Pokemon to 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Crabrawler
flavorText: Its hard pincers are well suited to both offense and defense. Fights between two Crabrawler are like boxing matches.
Attack2Text: If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, this attack does 60 more damage.

name: Crabominable
flavorText: It stores coldness in its pincers and pummels its foes. It can even smash thick walls of ice to bits!
Attack1Text: If you have fewer Pokemon in play than your opponent, this attack does 50 more damage for each Pokemon fewer you have in play.

name: Stakataka
flavorText: It appeared from an Ultra Wormhole. Each one appears to be made up of many life-forms stacked one on top of each other.
Ability1Text: If your opponent has 3 or fewer Prize cards remaining, this Pokemon's maximum HP is 200.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

name: Greninja & Zoroark-GX
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 more damage times the amount of Darkness Energy attached to all of your Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Put 2 in any combination of Darkness Pokemon-GX and Darkness Pokemon-EX from your discard pile onto your Bench. If this Pokemon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), attach 2 Energy cards from your discard pile to each Pokemon that you put onto your Bench in this way. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Murkrow
flavorText: It has a weakness for shiny things. It's been known to sneak into the nests of Gabite—noted collectors of jewels—in search of treasure.
Attack1Text: Choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into their deck.

name: Honchkrow-GX
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon, your opponent can't play any Pokemon Tool, Special Energy, or Stadium cards from their hand.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon-GX and Pokemon-EX. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard 2 cards from it. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Carvanha
flavorText: They're such cowards that they won't hunt alone. When five or so of them get together, they suddenly turn ferocious!

name: Sharpedo
flavorText: People believe that carrying one of its discarded fangs will prevent mishaps at sea, so the fangs are made into accessories.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokemon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokemon during your turn, you may look at the top 6 cards of your deck and attach any number of Darkness Energy cards you find there to this Pokemon. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of Darkness Energy attached to this Pokemon.

name: Spiritomb
flavorText: A Pokemon that was formed by 108 spirits. It is bound to a fissure in an odd keystone.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put 1 damage counter on this Pokemon.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokemon.

name: Sandile
flavorText: Alola, where it's warm all year round, is a comfortable environment for this Pokemon. Sometimes you'll even see it outside of deserts.
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon, your opponent's Active Pokemon's attacks do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Sandile
flavorText: Alola, where it's warm all year round, is a comfortable environment for this Pokemon. Sometimes you'll even see it outside of deserts.
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Pokemon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, this Pokemon's attacks do 120 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokemon during your next turn (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Krokorok
flavorText: Krokorok really hates it when its body gets cold. On nights when the temperature drops, it digs deep into the desert sands.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Krookodile
flavorText: When it spots prey, even at a distance of over 30 miles, it swims through the desert as if it were water, then jumps out and chomps them.
Attack1Text: This attack does 50 damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokemon's Retreat Cost.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Greninja
flavorText: It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.
Attack1Text: The Pokemon that has the least HP remaining, except for this Pokemon, is Knocked Out. (If multiple Pokemon are tied, choose one.)
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Inkay
flavorText: It draws prey near with its blinking lights and then wraps them up in its long tentacles and holds them in place.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Malamar
flavorText: When it comes to strong hypnosis, there's an endless number of people who utilize Malamar for their nefarious deeds.
Attack1Text: Your opponent reveals their hand. You may discard a Pokemon you find there and use one of that Pokemon's non-GX attacks as this attack.
Attack2Text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

name: Lucario & Melmetal-GX
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Metal Energy card and attach it to this Pokemon. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Alolan Diglett
flavorText: Although it's powerful enough to dig right through volcanic rock, it doesn't allow itself to be seen very often.

name: Alolan Dugtrio
flavorText: Its metallic whiskers are heavy, so it's not very fast, but it has the power to dig through bedrock.
Ability1Text: Your Metal Pokemon take 10 less damage from your opponent's attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Aron
flavorText: It usually lives deep in mountains. However, hunger may drive it to eat railroad tracks and cars.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokemon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Lairon
flavorText: It loves iron ore. Groups of them fight for territory by bashing one another with their steel bodies.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokemon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Aggron
flavorText: It claims an entire mountain as its own. The more wounds it has, the more it has battled, so don't take it lightly.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokemon is damaged by an attack (even if this Pokemon is Knocked Out), put 8 damage counters on the Attacking Pokemon.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon can't attack during your next turn.

name: Lucario
flavorText: It concentrates its mental energy and fires off mysterious waves called auras, which can crush boulders of large size to dust.
Attack2Text: If you attached a Pokemon Tool card from your hand to this Pokemon during this turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

name: Genesect
flavorText: This ancient bug Pokemon was altered by Team Plasma. They upgraded the cannon on its back.
Ability1Text: If your opponent has any Pokemon-GX or Pokemon-EX in play, this Pokemon has no Retreat Cost.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Meltan
flavorText: It melts particles of iron and other metals found in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its body of molten steel.
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is a Metal Pokemon, this attack does 40 more damage.

name: Melmetal
flavorText: Revered long ago for its capacity to create iron from nothing, for some reason it has come back to life after 3,000 years.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Metal Pokemon from your hand. If you do, heal 100 damage from this Pokemon.

name: Gardevoir & Sylveon-GX
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Fairy Energy cards and attach them to your Benched Pokemon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Move any number of Energy from your Pokemon to your other Pokemon in any way you like.

name: Cleffa
flavorText: On nights with many shooting stars, they gather in packs and dance in circles. If you should see them, something good will happen!
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, shuffle your hand into your deck and then draw 6 cards. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

name: Clefairy
flavorText: They're popular, but they're rare. Trainers who show them off recklessly may be targeted by thieves.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

name: Clefable
flavorText: It can't help but hear a pin drop from over half a mile away, so it lives deep in the mountains where there aren't many people or Pokemon.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your Pokemon that has any Fairy Energy attached to it.

name: Jigglypuff
flavorText: Recordings of Jigglypuff's strange lullabies can be purchased from department stores. These CDs can be found near the bedding area.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

name: Wigglytuff
flavorText: Thanks to its bouncy body and fine fur, this Pokemon is sought after. Holding one in your arms while you sleep feels great.
Attack1Text: Put 3 Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Togepi
flavorText: The shell seems to be filled with joy. It is said that it will share good luck when treated kindly.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokemon's attacks do 30 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Togetic
flavorText: It grows dispirited if it is not with kind people. It can float in midair without moving its wings.
Attack1Text: Attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Togekiss
flavorText: As everyone knows, it visits peaceful regions, bringing them gifts of kindness and sweet blessings.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 30 damage from each of your Fairy Pokemon.

name: Cottonee
flavorText: To protect itself, it shoots cotton from its body. When it gets wet in the rain, its cotton grows moist and heavy, and it can't move as well.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokemon takes 10 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Whimsicott-GX
Ability1Text: If any damage is done to this Pokemon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to this Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Search your deck for up to 5 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Spritzee
flavorText: It emits a scent that enraptures those who smell it. This fragrance changes depending on what it has eaten.
Attack1Text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokemon.

name: Aromatisse
flavorText: It devises various scents, pleasant and unpleasant, and emits scents that its enemies dislike in order to gain an edge in battle.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is heads, your opponent reveals their hand. For each heads, choose a card you find there. Your opponent shuffles those cards into their deck.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a Special Condition. Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now affected by that Special Condition.

name: Rattata
flavorText: Its incisors grow continuously throughout its life. If its incisors get too long, this Pokemon becomes unable to eat, and it starves to death.

name: Raticate
flavorText: People say that it fled from its enemies by using its small webbed hind feet to swim from island to island in Alola.
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is an Evolution Pokemon, switch this Pokemon with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Spearow
flavorText: Its reckless nature leads it to stand up to others—even large Pokemon—if it has to protect its territory.

name: Fearow
flavorText: Carrying food through Fearow's territory is dangerous. It will snatch the food away from you in a flash!
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard 2 Energy from your opponent's Active Pokemon.

name: Meowth
flavorText: When visiting a junkyard, you may catch sight of it having an intense fight with Murkrow over shiny objects.
Attack1Text: Draw 2 cards. If you do, this Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Persian
flavorText: Although the jewel on its forehead appears to be a different color than those of Alolan Persian, it's mostly made of the same material.
Ability1Text: Ignore all Energy in the attack costs of each of your Pokemon in play that has the Caturday attack.

name: Persian-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if 1 of your Pokemon-GX or Pokemon-EX was Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. You can't use more than 1 Cat Walk Ability each turn.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Pokemon in your discard pile. You can't add more than 180 damage in this way.
Attack2Text: Switch this Pokemon with 1 of your Benched Pokemon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Doduo
flavorText: A two-headed Pokemon that was discovered as a sudden mutation. It runs at a pace of over 60 miles per hour.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

name: Dodrio
flavorText: An enemy that takes its eyes off any of the three heads—even for a second—will get pecked severely.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon can't use Accelerating Stab during your next turn.

name: Lickitung
flavorText: It checks out whatever's around it by licking everything. If you don't clean off a spot where it's licked you, you'll break out in a rash!
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Lickilicky
flavorText: A contest is under way to determine which one can stick its tongue out the farthest. The current record is…more than 82 feet.
Attack1Text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokemon Tool cards from your opponent's Active Pokemon. If you discarded a Pokemon Tool card in this way, heal all damage from this Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

name: Porygon
flavorText: This Pokemon was created using the cutting-edge science of 20 years ago, so many parts of it have since become obsolete.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, search your deck for an Energy card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Porygon
flavorText: This Pokemon was created using the cutting-edge science of 20 years ago, so many parts of it have since become obsolete.
Attack1Text: Draw a card.

name: Porygon2
flavorText: AI has been installed in it. It learns various things all on its own, but it even remembers things it doesn't need to know.
Attack1Text: Draw 2 cards.

name: Porygon-Z
flavorText: Its behavior is noticeably unstable, which is apparently due to the incompetence of the engineer who updated its programming.
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Special Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokemon.
Attack1Text: This Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Snorlax
flavorText: It doesn't do anything other than eat and sleep. When prompted to make a serious effort, though, it apparently displays awesome power.
Ability1Text: Between turns, heal 10 damage from this Pokemon.
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is a TAG TEAM, this attack does 120 more damage.

name: Glameow
flavorText: It claws if displeased and purrs when affectionate. Its fickleness is very popular among some.
Attack1Text: Draw a card. If you do, this Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: This attack does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokemon-GX or Pokemon-EX. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Purugly
flavorText: It would claim another Pokemon's nest as its own if it finds a nest sufficiently comfortable.
Attack1Text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand. If this Pokemon evolved from Glameow during this turn, discard 2 cards instead of 1.

name: Happiny
flavorText: Usually it's a well-behaved Pokemon, but if you take its round rock away, it will cry and fuss and throw a big old tantrum.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, heal 60 damage from 1 of your Pokemon. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

name: Chatot
flavorText: It mimics the cries of other Pokemon to trick them into thinking it's one of them. This way they won't attack it.
Attack1Text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a card for each card in your opponent's hand.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Celesteela-GX
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokemon is your Active Pokemon, prevent all effects of your opponent's GX attacks, including damage, done to your Pokemon.
Attack1Text: Move an Energy from this Pokemon to 1 of your Benched Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Count your Prize cards and put them into your hand. Then, take that many cards from the top of your deck and put them face down as your Prize cards. If you don't have that many cards in your deck, this attack does nothing. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Pheromosa & Buzzwole-GX
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: During your next turn, this Pokemon's Elegant Sole attack's base damage is 60.

name: Pheromosa & Buzzwole-GX
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)
Attack2Text: During your next turn, this Pokemon's Elegant Sole attack's base damage is 60.

name: Venomoth-GX
Attack1Text: If you played Koga's Trap from your hand during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage. If you played Janine from your hand during this turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokemon by attacks from Basic Pokemon during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 10 cards. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Reshiram & Charizard-GX
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokemon.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon can't use Flare Strike during your next turn.

name: Dedenne-GX
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokemon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard your hand and draw 6 cards. You can't use more than 1 Dedechange Ability each turn.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed. Put this Pokemon and all cards attached to it into your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Dedenne-GX
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokemon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard your hand and draw 6 cards. You can't use more than 1 Dedechange Ability each turn.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed. Put this Pokemon and all cards attached to it into your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Muk & Alolan Muk-GX
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Poisoned. Put 8 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokemon between turns.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is Poisoned, heal 100 damage from this Pokemon.

name: Muk & Alolan Muk-GX
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Poisoned. Put 8 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokemon between turns.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokemon is Poisoned, heal 100 damage from this Pokemon.

name: Marshadow & Machamp-GX
Attack1Text: If any of your Pokemon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Marshadow & Machamp-GX
Attack1Text: If any of your Pokemon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

name: Greninja & Zoroark-GX
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 more damage times the amount of Darkness Energy attached to all of your Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Put 2 in any combination of Darkness Pokemon-GX and Darkness Pokemon-EX from your discard pile onto your Bench. If this Pokemon has at least 1 extra Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), attach 2 Energy cards from your discard pile to each Pokemon that you put onto your Bench in this way. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

Attack2Text: Put 2 in any combination of Darkness Pokemon-GX and Darkness Pokemon-EX from your discard pile onto your Bench. Attack2Text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Discard 2 cards from it. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Metal Energy card and attach it to this Pokemon. Then, shuffle your deck.

Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Fairy Energy cards and attach them to your Benched Pokemon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Move any number of Energy from your Pokemon to your other Pokemon in any way you like.

Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Fairy Energy cards and attach them to your Benched Pokemon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Move any number of Energy from your Pokemon to your other Pokemon in any way you like.

Attack1Text: This attack does 30 more damage times the amount of Energy attached to this Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Search your deck for up to 5 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Reshiram & Charizard-GX
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokemon.
Attack2Text: This Pokemon can't use Flare Strike during your next turn.

name: Blastoise-GX
Ability1Text: This Pokemon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: Shuffle any amount of Water Energy from your Pokemon into your deck. This attack does 60 damage for each card you shuffled into your deck in this way.
Attack2Text: Attach any number of Water Energy cards from your hand to your Pokemon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
